title: A Death in Zamora
author: Ramón Sender Barayón
description: A gripping story that takes place during the Spanish Civil War through the lens of personal discovery, truth, and hidden family history.

title: It's About Sound
author: Joel Chadabe
description: This book explores music’s role in daily life — sing, play, listen. It's about how sound connects us all through emotion and memory.

title: The Musical World of Paul Winter
author: Bob Gluck
description: Environment and music meet. From the Grand Canyon to New York, Paul Winter’s sonic journey blends culture and conservation.

title: John Cage's Greatest Hits
author: Richard Kostelanetz
description: A celebration of John Cage — revolutionary composer, thinker, and sound adventurer. A bold reimagining of what music can mean.

title: Naked Close-Up
author: Ramón Sender Barayón
description: An insider’s view of the San Francisco ’60s music and art scene. Colorful, raw, unforgettable — once in a lifetime moments.

title: Arts Sciences Alloys
author: Iannis Xenakis
description: A deep dive into Xenakis’s thesis — where science meets sound. A fusion of math, architecture, and music unlike any other.

title: Here and Now
author: Vanessa Tomlinson and Toby Wren
description: Artistic research and performance come together. A fresh take on new music, collaboration, and reflective creative practice.

title: On Innovative Musicians
author: Richard Kostelanetz
description: Interviews and essays on groundbreaking artists — their voices, their tools, their revolutions in sound and method.

title: Words by Memory
author: Jalalu-Kalvert Nelson
description: Poems and reflections from a master of both words and music. Deeply personal, wildly creative, and profoundly musical.

title: Compose Your Words
author: Leigh Landy
description: Our voice is the ultimate instrument. This book explores how we use sound, text, and tone to shape meaning and connection.

title: Mind Pieces
author: Eduardo Reck Miranda
description: A glimpse into the future of music technology. This book examines computers, AI, and how they’re reshaping composition and sound.

title: Text-Sound
author: Richard Kostelanetz
description: Vocal art and poetry in motion. A study of sound-text and the creative blend of word and music in new media.

title: Voices of Resistance
author: Maya Greene
description: A collection of powerful essays and interviews from artists pushing boundaries and reshaping cultural norms.

title: Echoes of the Future
author: Kenji Tanaka
description: Speculative music writing and experiments in futuristic sonic landscapes. A treat for sci-fi and audio lovers alike.

title: The Listening Mind
author: Sarah DuPont
description: What does it mean to listen? This book explores the psychology and philosophy of hearing and understanding through sound.

title: Fragments of Noise
author: Luis Martínez
description: An artistic exploration of noise as beauty — fragmented, layered, and intentional in every sense.
